slides.title: Basketball
slides.text: In this basketball game, the player can move around, jump, and throw basketballs at a hovering hoop.

slides.title: Rename Sprite1
slides.text: Rename the Cat Sprite Click the blue-white (i) button to open the Info Panel, then rename it "Cat".

slides.title: Change the Backdrop
slides.text: Click the landscape button next to "New backdrop" and select "brick wall1".

slides.title: Add Gravity to the Cat
slides.text: Click on the Cat icon in the lower left area. Click the "Make a Variable" button and name it "y velocity". Click on "For this sprite only".

slides.text:

If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Test #9
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Then test to make sure your program has the following:
  • Shoot some baskets. The Player 1 Score variable should increase only if the basketball touches the center of the hoop and is moving down.
  • The Hoop sprite should say swoosh and play the cheer sound when this happens.

If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.
